description.plain:
The Egyptian Lover (born Greg Broussard on August 31, 1963) is a Los Angeles-based producer, vocalist and DJ who was popular during the 1980s for his hip-hop/electro-funk hybrid songs created from the Roland TR-808 analog drum machine. He joined Uncle Jamm’s Army as a DJ in the early ‘80s and rocked parties for thousands of people with them at venues such as the L.A. Sports Arena. In 1984, he released his most popular single, “Egypt, Egypt,” and this led to him establishing his own label, Egyptian Empire Records, and releasing his first album On the Nile.

He went on to release a few more albums throughout the years, including his second album One Track Mind in 1986, Back from the Tomb in 1994, Platinum Pyramids in 2006, and 1984 in 2015, which he recorded in the same studio where he made his debut album. In 2016, Peanut Butter Wolf released the Egyptian Lover anthology album 1983-1988 on Stones Throw, featuring selections from his first two albums as well as some previously unreleased and remixed material. He returned in 2018 with the album 1985, featuring more of his signature electro-funk on songs such as his cover of Wham!’s 1984 hit “Everything She Wants.”

annotatable.title: Egyptian Lover

body.plain:
The Egyptian Lover (born Greg Broussard on August 31, 1963) is a Los Angeles-based producer, vocalist and DJ who was popular during the 1980s for his hip-hop/electro-funk hybrid songs created from the Roland TR-808 analog drum machine. He joined Uncle Jamm’s Army as a DJ in the early ‘80s and rocked parties for thousands of people with them at venues such as the L.A. Sports Arena. In 1984, he released his most popular single, “Egypt, Egypt,” and this led to him establishing his own label, Egyptian Empire Records, and releasing his first album On the Nile.

He went on to release a few more albums throughout the years, including his second album One Track Mind in 1986, Back from the Tomb in 1994, Platinum Pyramids in 2006, and 1984 in 2015, which he recorded in the same studio where he made his debut album. In 2016, Peanut Butter Wolf released the Egyptian Lover anthology album 1983-1988 on Stones Throw, featuring selections from his first two albums as well as some previously unreleased and remixed material. He returned in 2018 with the album 1985, featuring more of his signature electro-funk on songs such as his cover of Wham!’s 1984 hit “Everything She Wants.”

songs.full_title: Egypt, Egypt by Egyptian Lover
songs.title: Egypt, Egypt

description.plain:
The best-known song by L.A. electro hip-hop pioneer Greg Broussard, aka Egyptian Lover,  “Egypt, Egypt” has its roots in an earlier tune called “Beast Beats.”

As the DJ and producer told LA Weekly, he scrapped the original version after his sister cautioned, “Don’t play with the devil like that.”

Her warning triggered memories of a guy he’d met at a party a year and a half earlier. This dude looked like the Devil and offered prophecy that nearly came true.

He spoke to me and said, “Egyptian Lover, you’re going to be a big star one day and your first hit song will be called ‘Beast Beats.’”

Rather than tempt fate, Egyptian Lover “tore up” “Beats Beast” and created something totally new.

That record is actually a creation of four to five songs that I had pieced together. It was made as though I was DJ'ing those different songs all together in to one mix.

Why are you so damn strange? (rhythmic breathing)
What the hell is wrong with your brains? (rhythmic breathing)
Have you always been like this? (rhythmic breathing)
Why don't you try a masculine kiss? (kissing sounds)

She took me to
The Alez-by Inn

A little strange, but i'm diggin' it

That's where we went
The Alez-by Inn

You make me call the

songs.full_title: Los Angeles by Egyptian Lover
songs.title: Los Angeles

description.plain: Egyptian Lover is detailing his weekend in the streets of Los Angeles. He’s cruising down several strips, visiting Venice Beach, and maybe doing a little shopping at the Slauson Swap Meet while seeing beautiful women and hearing the beautiful sound of his music coming from other cars in these locales.

body.plain: Egyptian Lover is detailing his weekend in the streets of Los Angeles. He’s cruising down several strips, visiting Venice Beach, and maybe doing a little shopping at the Slauson Swap Meet while seeing beautiful women and hearing the beautiful sound of his music coming from other cars in these locales.

songs.lyrics:
Los Angeles LyricsCrenshaw
Slauson
Venice
Sunset

I like to drive down the streets in L.A
It’s like heaven to see all the wild girlies
Another Friday night from Hollywood Boulevard
Everyone’s there, we’re cruising hard

Los…Angeles (Repeat 4X)
My beat’s bumping in everyone’s car
And my kinky sound no matter how far
This is the place where we choose to meet
Where Blazers and Nissans boom the beat
Now work your woofers

Boom, boom-boom, boom, boom-boom (Repeat 4X)

Cruising down Crenshaw on Saturday night
Pearl black paint job glowing in the moonlight
Your Alpine’s turned up with the woofers pumpin’
Egyptian Lover’s new beat got the boulevard jumpin’

Los…Angeles (Repeat 4X)

Venice Beach on Sunday, I can hardly wait
That’s when the freaks come out to roller-skate
Girls as far as the eye can see
Bikinis are surrounding me

Boom, boom-boom, boom, boom-boom (Repeat 4X)

Los…Angeles

Boom, boom-boom, boom, boom-boom (Repeat 4X)
You might also likeLos…Angeles (Repeat 2X)

L.A

BOO-YOW!Embed

No matter what we do, the world keeps turning

No matter what we do, the world keeps turning
